sen.j: 楠葉 西忍（くすば さいにん、応永2年（1395年） - 文明 (日本)18年2月13日（1486年3月18日））は、室町時代の商人。
sen.e: Sainin KUSUBA (1395 to March 18, 1486) was a merchant in the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 俗名（通称）は天次で、西忍は出家した後の号。
sen.e: His unofficial name was Tenji, and Sainin was the name after he entered the priesthood.

sen.j: 父の天竺人（この天竺がどこを指すかは不明。インド、ジャワもしくはアラビアの可能性もあり）の商人・ヒジリは足利義満の時代に来日し、京都の相国寺に居住して絶海中津の庇護を受けていた。
sen.e: His father, who was a foreigner possibly from India, Java or Arabia, came to Japan as a merchant in the days of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA and lived in Shokoku-ji Temple, Kyoto, under the aegis of Chushin ZEKKAI.

sen.j: やがて河内国の楠葉（現大阪府枚方市樟葉駅付近）の娘を妻とし、西忍が生まれた。
sen.e: Then he married a woman from Kuzuha, an area near today's Kuzuha Station, Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture, in Kawachi Province and had Sainin as their son.

sen.j: のち西忍が楠葉を姓としたのは母の出身地による。
sen.e: Sainin later took Kuzuha as his surname because it was where his mother was born and raised.

sen.j: はじめ京都の三条坊門烏丸に居住し「有徳の者」と称されたが、征夷大将軍足利義持の勘気を受けて（詳細は不明）、父子ともに大和国立野に移り住み、興福寺大乗院に奉仕する。
sen.e: They first settled at Karasuma, Sanjobomon Alley, Kyoto, and his father was known to be "a man of high virtue," but as he incurred the displeasure of the then Seii Taishogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA (for unknown reasons), he and his family moved to Tatsuno, Yamato Province and served Daijo-in, Kofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: これは主語は誰ですか。西忍の父と理解しました。「父子とも」とありますが、妻はどうなのでしょうか。またヒジリには二人息子がいたとのことで、二人目が生まれていたかどうか、複数形のないこの日本語の表現ではわからないので、his family としました。

sen.j: 父の死後、大乗院の坊主・実弾房宗信の妹・戌亥を娶る。
sen.e: After his father died, he married Inui, sister of one of the priests of Daijo-in, Minenobu JITSUDANBO.

sen.j: 永享元年（1429年）に長男の元次が誕生した。
sen.e: Inui gave birth to a son, their first child, named Mototsugu, in 1429.

sen.e: Thereafter, he and his wife had two more boys and two girls.

sen.j: 永享4年（1432年）はじめて遣明船にて明国へ渡航。
sen.e: In 1432, he sailed to Ming Dynasty aboard an envoy ship.

sen.j: 享徳2年（1453年）二度目の渡明では、興福寺末寺の多武峰寺・長谷寺共同の船の外官となり、息子元次を同行させた。
sen.e: In 1453, on his second sail to Ming, he served as a government official aboard a ship jointly arranged by Tonomine-dera Temple and Hase-dera Temple, both branch temples of Kofuku-ji Temple, and had his son Mototsugu also join the crew.
sen.cmt: 興福寺の末寺なのは、多武峰寺と長谷寺の両方、と理解しました。長谷寺が末寺、とはあるので、多武峰寺も当然末寺だと理解しました。

sen.j: 南京市を経て、首都北京市まで赴き、直接貿易に関わり、銅と生糸・明銭などの交易に携わった。
sen.e: He went up to the capital Beijing via Nanjing and directly engaged in trading to trade copper, raw silk and Ming coins.
He went up to the capital Beijing via Nanjing and worked directly in the trade of copper, raw silk and Ming coins.

sen.j: これらの西忍の交易活動は、帰国後興福寺に報告され、大乗院主尋尊によって「大乗院寺社雑事記」「唐船日記」などに詳細に記されており、当時の日明勘合貿易の実際を知る上での貴重な史料となっている。
sen.e: His trading activities were reported to Kofuku-ji Temple after their return and put on record in detail in such documents as the Miscellany of the Daijoin and the Tosen Nikki (lit. "Tosen Journal") by Jinson of Daijo-in, which serve as valuable historical data to describe the actual activities of trading between two countries in those days.
